thread.title: Fox’s Eric Bolling Doesn’t Like That John McCain Is Trying to ‘Undercut’ Trump
thread.title_full: Fox’s Eric Bolling Doesn’t Like That John McCain Is Trying to ‘Undercut’ Trump

author: Josh Feldman
title: Fox’s Eric Bolling Doesn’t Like That John McCain Is Trying to ‘Undercut’ Trump
text:
Fox’s Eric Bolling Doesn’t Like That John McCain Is Trying to ‘Undercut’ Trump by Josh Feldman | 5:48   
Fox News’ Eric Bolling expressed his disdain for John McCain today on a number of fronts, including that he’s “very vocally pushing back on a lot of Trump initiatives.” 
McCain disputed the White House assessment that the Yemen raid was a success, which led to a scolding from Sean Spicer and McCain firing right back. Bolling, who doesn’t like McCain in general, said he doesn’t care for McCain “taking shots” so much at the president. 
Greg Gutfeld pointed out if the name of the game here is conservative orthodoxy, President Trump isn’t exactly the most consistent here. 
Bolling pointed to McCain’s stances on immigration, war, and cap-and-trade before outright saying, “The biggest thing I don’t like about him is that he’s a well-respected senior senator who’s very vocally pushing back on a lot of Trump initiatives.” 
Bob Beckel pushed back and slammed Trump for just making things up, as well as lashing out at people like McCain, but Bolling insisted, “Donald Trump is not gonna sit back and let John McCain undercut a lot of the things that he’s trying to do! I don’t blame him!” 
They kept going back and forth and Beckel told him at one point, “You’re apologizing for Trump’s mismanagement of his job.” Bolling insisted he wasn’t. 
Watch above, via Fox News. 
[ image via screengrab ]
